entries.title: US court strikes down South Carolina abortion ban
entries.description: The ban had faced legal challenges for barring abortion at six weeks, before most parents realise they are pregnant.

entries.title: New York sues Celsius founder alleging crypto fraud
entries.description: Civil lawsuit seeks to ban Alex Mashinsky from doing business in New York and have him pay damages for violating laws.

entries.title: US waged war on China’s chips; S Korea, Taiwan felt the fallout
entries.description: Washington's bid for self-sufficiency in semiconductors is complicating relations with its tech-savvy partners in Asia.

entries.title: Two-thirds of glaciers projected to disappear by 2100: Study
entries.description: Eighty-three percent of the world’s glaciers might disappear within eight decades, new research shows.

entries.title: Twitter hacked, 200 million email addresses leaked: Researcher
entries.description: There are no clues to the identity or location of the hacker or hackers who may have breached Twitter as early as 2021.

entries.title: Germany to send armoured carriers, Patriot battery to Ukraine
entries.description: Germany's decision comes after France said it will hold talks with Kyiv to arrange the delivery of armoured vehicles.

entries.title: As pressure builds, crypto firm Genesis cuts 30% of workforce
entries.description: Several firms have suffered from waning investor appetite for crypto after major exchange FTX blew up late last year.

entries.title: Prince Harry reveals he killed 25 in Afghanistan: British media
entries.description: Prince Harry admitted to killing 25 people during his military service, saying he is neither proud nor ashamed of it.

entries.title: US, Turkey target alleged ISIL supporters with sanctions
entries.description: Joint action comes amid strained relations between US and Turkey that have complicated the fight against ISIL (ISIS).

entries.title: FIFA names first female international referee from Saudi Arabia
entries.description: Anoud al-Asmari is one of eight Saudis on the international panel announced by football's global governing body.

entries.title: M23 rebels pledge to withdraw from eastern DRC town
entries.description: The DRC slammed the move as a 'sham' designed to distract from the group reinforcing its positions elsewhere.

entries.title: What are the prospects for a lasting peace in DR Congo?
entries.description: M-23 fighters say they are pulling out of a town in the east, but the Congolese army says it might be a sham.

entries.title: Child killed as ‘bomb cyclone’ ravages US state of California
entries.description: The storm is the third in a series of extreme weather events to hit the drought-stricken state in the span of a week.

entries.title: Ukraine rejects Putin’s Orthodox Christmas ceasefire proposal
entries.description: Ukraine rejects truce until Russia withdraws from occupied territory after Russian president proposes 36-hour ceasefire.

entries.title: Violence breaks out as Mexico arrests son of ‘El Chapo’ Guzman
entries.description: Cartels have sometimes unleashed violence on cities in retaliation for the arrest of prominent cartel figures.

entries.title: World’s ‘most wanted people smuggler’ arrested in Sudan
entries.description: UAE says it played key role in operation to detain Eritrean national Kidane Zekarias Habtemariam, wanted by Interpol.

entries.title: US labour market was still resilient at the end of 2022
entries.description: Reports suggested economy ended 2022 on solid footing, despite layoffs in tech and finance, indicating more rate rises.

entries.title: US unveils new border curbs for Haitians, Cubans, Nicaraguans
entries.description: Joe Biden says new rules allowing asylum seekers to be returned to Mexico aim to reduce arrivals at US southern border.

entries.title: Erdogan says he may meet Syria’s Assad for ‘peace’ in the region
entries.description: Turkish president says he could hold talks with Syrian leader within a new process launched in Moscow last week.

entries.title: Uncertainty persists as US House heads to another speaker vote
entries.description: While some Republicans have spoken of 'progress', dissenters against Kevin McCarthy say he still doesn't have the votes.

entries.title: Belarusian Nobel Peace Prize winner goes on trial in Minsk
entries.description: Ales Bialiatski faces up to 12 years in prison for financing anti-government protests.

entries.title: Lebanon charges seven over UN peacekeeper Sean Rooney’s killing
entries.description: With only one of seven suspects in custody, search is under way for the other six to determine their whereabouts.

entries.title: Uganda’s Ebola outbreak nearly under control, says Africa CDC
entries.description: The continental health body says the Ebola outbreak will be over if no new cases are reported in Uganda by January 10.

entries.title: Eight, including five children, shot dead in US state of Utah
entries.description: Officials in the small town of Enoch, 394km south of Salt Lake City, say the victims are members of the same family.

entries.title: The far-right movement at the heart of Israel’s new government
entries.description: This is why Israel’s new government is the most far-right in its history.

entries.title: Wagner chief frees prisoners who fought in Ukraine for Russia
entries.description: Yevgeny Prigozhin filmed telling convicts who served six months on the front line, 'don't rape women' in Russia.

entries.title: Turkish court suspends funding for main pro-Kurdish party
entries.description: The Peoples' Democratic Party (HDP) is being deprived of a key source of revenue ahead of elections expected in June.

entries.title: What to do if stranded in a car in cold weather
entries.description: A survival expert has tips on trying to stay safe in that situation.

entries.title: Kenya’s ‘swap and go’ electric motorbikes
entries.description: Kenya’s motorbike riders are getting eco-friendly alternatives thanks to a new generation of electric vehicles.

entries.title: Amazon to cut more than 18,000 roles, CEO says
entries.description: The job-slashing plan is the largest among recent workforce reductions that have affected the US tech sector.

entries.title: Who’s to blame for the ‘broken’ US immigration system?
entries.description: US officials admit that the country’s immigration system is 'broken', but where is the solution?

entries.title: Middle East round-up: Ben-Gvir enters Al-Aqsa
entries.description: Here’s a round-up of Al Jazeera’s Middle East coverage this week.

entries.title: France backs envoy despite Burkina pressure for withdrawal
entries.description: France's foreign ministry is standing by its ambassador amid mounting anti-French sentiment in Burkina Faso.

entries.title: Morocco links Israel embassy to W Sahara recognition: Report
entries.description: Israel has refused to engage on the issue, despite Moroccan demands, reports Axios.

entries.title: NATO should renew its commitment to Kosovo
entries.description: Serbia's refusal to accept Kosovo's sovereignty is increasing the possibility of renewed conflict in the region.

entries.title: Ukraine starts new year with major attack on Russian troops
entries.description: 2023 begins with a Ukrainian offensive and defensive success, while the prospect for peace remains dim.

entries.title: UK’s Prince Harry alleges brother William attacked him: Report
entries.description: Spare, Prince Harry's tell-all book, includes details of alleged attack, the Guardian reports.

entries.title: Mali escapes sanctions over detention of 46 Ivorian soldiers
entries.description: The Ivorian troops were arrested at the Bamako airport on July 10, with the Malians accusing them of being mercenaries.

entries.title: Planetary Justice: Climate liability and nature’s legal rights
entries.description: earthrise explores how the law is granting rights to nature and holding multinationals to account.

entries.title: Taliban says eight ISIL fighters killed in raids in Afghanistan
entries.description: The raids follow a series of attacks conducted by ISIL, including a deadly bombing near a checkpoint in Kabul.

entries.title: Israeli forces kill 16-year-old Palestinian in Nablus
entries.description: Amer Abu Zaytoon is the fourth Palestinian to be killed this year by Israeli forces in the occupied West Bank.

entries.title: Longest-serving Palestinian prisoner released from Israeli prison
entries.description: Karim Younis, 66, has been released from Israeli prisons after serving 40 years for the killing of an Israeli soldier.

entries.title: US empire’s legacy: Fallujah and football played in a graveyard
entries.description: The US is now ransacking Fallujah's name, too, while the system it bequeathed Iraqis seeks legitimacy through football.

entries.title: India top court stays demolition of over 4,000 homes in Haldwani
entries.description: More than 50,000 people, mostly Muslims, faced the demolition of their homes which allegedly encroached on railway land.

entries.title: Thousands pour into St. Peter’s for funeral of Benedict XVI
entries.description: Mourners gather at the Vatican to pay final respects to German theologian Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI.

entries.title: China, Philippines commit to peaceful South China Sea solution
entries.description: Xi and Marcos hold talks in Beijing, agree to manage differences over the South China Sea 'through peaceful means'.

entries.title: Reyna family flagged US coach Berhalter’s domestic abuse incident
entries.description: US football head coach Gregg Berhalter and the family of player Gio Reyna are embroiled in a messy public dispute.

entries.title: As China cases surge, countries test airline wastewater for COVID
entries.description: Experts say testing wastewater from flights from China will help identify new variants that might emerge.

entries.title: US court hands ex-Bolivia interior minister 6-year jail sentence
entries.description: Court finds Arturo Murillo guilty of conspiracy to commit money laundering and sentences him to 70 months in prison.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 316
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 316th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: N Korea drone entered presidential office no-fly zone: Military
entries.description: The drone was among five North Korean unmanned aerial vehicles that crossed into South Korea's airspace on December 26.

entries.title: Asia stocks hit 4-month high on China’s reopening
entries.description: Investors hope that once the COVID infection waves pass, life and spending can return to normal.

entries.title: China announces reopening of border with Hong Kong
entries.description: Announcement comes after three years of border controls that have isolated the financial hub from the Chinese mainland.

entries.title: EU recommends pre-departure COVID tests for passengers from China
entries.description: EU also urges wastewater testing on aircraft and for passengers travelling to and from China to wear face masks.

entries.title: Ukraine to get armoured combat vehicles from West, asks for tanks
entries.description: France confirms it will send first light tanks to Ukraine, while the US considers sending Bradley fighting vehicles.

entries.title: China’s ‘zero-COVID’ U-turn leads to loss of faith in leadership
entries.description: Previously told Chinese people were fighting the virus together, some are disillusioned after the abrupt policy change.

entries.title: Israel’s new government unveils plan to weaken Supreme Court
entries.description: New justice minister wants to curb the power of the high court, a move critics say would undermine democracy.

entries.title: Architect of US college admissions scam receives prison sentence
entries.description: University admissions consultant Rick Singer receives three and a half years in prison for masterminding bribery scheme.
